Remark. We just looked at projections of vectorsxonto a subspaceU with
basis vectors {b1,..., bk}. If this basis is an ONB, i.e., (3.33) and (3.34)
are satisﬁed, the projection equation (3.58) simpliﬁes greatly to
πU(x) = BB⊤x (3.65)
since B⊤B= Iwith coordinates
λ= B⊤x. (3.66)
This means that we no longer have to compute the inverse from (3.58),
which saves computation time. ♦
